intro: Eriospermum cecilii, commonly known as the Cecil's eriosperm, is a rare flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, woolly, and hairy foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late summer, adding a subtle ornamental value. It thrives in well-drained sandy soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
